2c660b31ca277fdc1018e8ad38348aa4 (18:21): I ask because I have a container div in which 3 columns are situated. now let's say the rightmost column is the one with the most height and the container background color is red.. in moz there is nothing visible, in IE I have a red square
2c660b31ca277fdc1018e8ad38348aa4 (18:22): what I want to do is to have all columns fill the whole height, but margin-bottom: 0px; won't work for me :(

4721eab864d8c99c7f9c27f44bf1f9f6 (19:01): can anyone give me some advice about css and menus? i have a left nav and right nav and a middle content div tags, all three are in a parent div tag, I have floated the right and left menus but I'm having trouble getting the content div to fill the gap
4721eab864d8c99c7f9c27f44bf1f9f6 (19:02): in between each of the menus, if I set the width to 100% it makes the width the same as the screen and everything gets displaced.
4721eab864d8c99c7f9c27f44bf1f9f6 (19:04): Am I describing the problem correctly or is this room just empty?
2c660b31ca277fdc1018e8ad38348aa4 (19:07): doctor: have the same problem atm
2c660b31ca277fdc1018e8ad38348aa4 (19:07): i can tell you how you can fill the center, but unfortunately the height is then not automatically adjusted :)
423b8ccb769f5c7b7ecf265741fc9497 (19:17): DoctorMO: #left,#content,#right{float:left;}¬  ¬ Do
423b8ccb769f5c7b7ecf265741fc9497 (19:18): and set their width
4721eab864d8c99c7f9c27f44bf1f9f6 (19:18): that would produce a fixed width system
423b8ccb769f5c7b7ecf265741fc9497 (19:18): width:30%; width: 20%; width:50%; and it's fluid
4721eab864d8c99c7f9c27f44bf1f9f6 (19:19): pierroo, ok you are correct but then that meens you can't mix static and fluid elements.
cf908f121d1742c15359507b9031ba83 (19:29): can anybody recommend a good css tooltip system which works in IE and FF
4721eab864d8c99c7f9c27f44bf1f9f6 (19:31): bullr[a]ge, most of the time you can use the title or alt attributes on objects, title will work in IE7 and Firefox/Mozilla, khtml and Galean.
cf908f121d1742c15359507b9031ba83 (19:31): DoctorMO, thanks. I'll try that.
4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:31): hi, is there a way to update a css style using javascript?
4721eab864d8c99c7f9c27f44bf1f9f6 (19:31): I don't think it's a css thing, it's an html thing
4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:32): so all the elements it's applied to, will automatically change?
4721eab864d8c99c7f9c27f44bf1f9f6 (19:33): kosh[0], my object = document.getElementById( 'blah' ); object.style.border.width = '4px';
4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:33): erm, I mean great!
b59634171b64fe2abfd24b4d6fa550ca (19:33): Hi all
4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:33): erm, thats not really what I was asking
4721eab864d8c99c7f9c27f44bf1f9f6 (19:33): kosh[0], then please be more clear
4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:33): I was hoping I could change the style itself and all the elements it's attached to, would be updated

4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:34): so instead of changing the style block of an individual element, you'd change the style itself and all the elements that have that style applied, would update
4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:34): if you catch my drift
4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:35): I'm guessing you don't ?
4721eab864d8c99c7f9c27f44bf1f9f6 (19:35): kosh[0], you mean update the style sheet dynamicly

4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:36): and all the elements appling those styles, would update, it would mean instead of changing every element which has a class applied, you'd change the style once and the browser would re-render all the elements in the way you wanted
4721eab864d8c99c7f9c27f44bf1f9f6 (19:37): kosh[0], have a look at document.styleSheets (array)

4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:37): of couse this technique wouldnt work to classes applied to different types of elements which need to be independantly styled, but my point is that it would help this particular situation
4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:37): ah ok, thanks
4721eab864d8c99c7f9c27f44bf1f9f6 (19:38): kosh[0], http://www.howtocreate.co.uk/tutorials/javascript/domcss
4721eab864d8c99c7f9c27f44bf1f9f6 (19:38): kosh[0], it's an interesting requirement one which I will store for future.
4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:38): yeah, I thought it would save a bunch of largely unnecessary work to be honest
4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:38): update once, instead of like 10 times, for one action
4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:39): makes sense in my opinion, but of course, not applicable to all situations
4721eab864d8c99c7f9c27f44bf1f9f6 (19:39): css dom might not work with all browsers so you might have a limited publishing scope
4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:39): hmmm, it's like we're thinking the same thing at the same time
4cf164ff5abf5be6f9194916af807dd7 (19:42): as long as it runs in safari, latest IE and firefox stable, I'm cool I think

2c660b31ca277fdc1018e8ad38348aa4 (19:53): according to these sites they're working on column based layouts for css 3.0
2c660b31ca277fdc1018e8ad38348aa4 (19:54): which will not be supported by all browsers of course ;)
